column4: You cannot defeat a pandemic if you cannot accept that a pandemic exists. As new cases spiked to record highs, the White House on Tuesday listed “ending the COVID-19 pandemic” as Trump's top scientific achievement. You can't wish away the problem. https://t.co/8yqWICUNeY

The president’s chief of staff said, “We’re not going to control the pandemic.” The reason we can’t control it is because of the failures of this administration to take it seriously. This is a lack of leadership that has failed the American people. https://t.co/0PNi6hE3a0

After pushing through a Supreme Court nominee and breaking all previous norms about the timing of the process, the Senate GOP leadership has gone out of session until after the election—without voting on a COVID relief plan that is so desperately needed by so many Americans.

The House passed a $3T COVID relief bill in May. Mitch McConnell has refused to call a vote on it. Since then, 6.5M+ Americans have tested positive. Asked about the delay during a debate, McConnell bizarrely & repeatedly laughed. Americans are hurting-this is no laughing matter.

Senate GOP leader Mitch McConnell has again rejected a coronavirus relief bill based on what the House and White House are calling for. His obstruction and unwillingness to compromise is hurting Americans who desperately need relief. https://t.co/qXUAeQtB3W

Disturbing report that while publicly dismissing the looming pandemic’s potential impacts, the Trump Admin in late-February passed along a much grimmer picture to elite investors, allowing them to short the market before its historic March drop. https://t.co/toJHCl2zNK
This is no time for half measures. We need to contain the virus, support the American people and support local communities. Schools, businesses and families desperately need our aid. #HeroesActNow

A far-right Supreme Court could end the Affordable Care Act and throw our entire healthcare system into chaos. All those who rely on protections for preexisting conditions, the Medicaid expansion and so much more would be devastated. We can’t accept that.

Make no mistake, an extremist majority on the Supreme Court could easily destroy the Affordable Care Act. Preexisting conditions would lose coverage. Medicaid expansions could be gutted. In the middle of a pandemic, it would be a humanitarian disaster. https://t.co/fFoD5FaQku

Aid to state and local governments isn’t a giveaway. Revenue that supports vital services- first responders, education, public health, and more- has collapsed, as costs have soared. We need to avoid damaging cuts. The administration is holding all relief hostage!
RT @LBHealthDept: Let's help #SlowtheSpreadLB!

During the pandemic the Trump Administration was handing oil and gas royalty relief to companies so recklessly that it’s impossible to even properly analyze the costs and benefits of doing so. This is unacceptable. #PeopleOverPolluters https://t.co/VjzCURam0C

No one should downplay the threat of this virus. Cases are rising nationwide, and conditions could get worse if we let our guard down. We can’t afford to give up our progress, and we can’t wait for a real national testing system which will finally defeat & contain the pandemic.

I am deeply disappointed, yet unsurprised, by the administration’s continued refusal to be candid with the American people, and their refusal to protect others—from staff to reporters and Secret Service officers. They need to take the virus seriously, on all levels.

Last week's jobs reports are a grim reminder that we cannot return to normal until the virus is contained, and we cannot delay direct assistance for the American people. The House repeatedly passed sweeping packages. Sen. McConnell must end his obstruction!

Right now, we have to unite, and do everything possible to defend the ACA from radical and undemocratic GOP legal assaults. I continue to look to a future, though, where we can truly guarantee #MedicareForAll. Healthcare is a human right.

QAnon is a toxic movement. The FBI has clearly identified it as a threat to national security, linked to violence. Every American should condemn it. Proud to support my colleague, @RepMalinowski and to pass H.Res  1154 to repudiate this vile conspiracy theory.

The Heroes Act would have protected the economy, contained the virus and saved local governments. The GOP has blocked it for months as the American people suffered. This week, we voted on an updated package to provide Heroes Act’s vital programs on a short-term basis. 1/2
I wish the President and First lady a speedy and safe recovery. Remember that the virus is still serious threat. Wear a mask. Maintain social distancing. Wash your hands.

On Tuesday, we saw President Trump’s bullying, dishonesty, and contempt for our democratic institutions on full display. He’s still trying to destroy healthcare & harm millions. He’s still refusing to take the virus seriously. He refused to condemn white supremacists. Enough.
Don’t wait to get your flu shot! A bad flu season could burden our healthcare system when it’s most vulnerable. Do your part to help protect our community! https://t.co/1hr1fYT0MI

We’ve passed 200,000 deaths caused by the pandemic. Each one was a fellow American, a friend, a neighbor, a relative. Our hearts break for them. Republicans #FailThePeople. We must take long overdue action to contain the virus. We need nationwide testing and federal aid now.

I’m proud of the progress we’ve made to suppress the second wave of Covid infections—but we know that the pandemic is far from over. Don’t let down your guard. Avoid indoor gatherings. Wear a mask. Observe social distancing. Wash your hands. https://t.co/OlNxpD1OPf

We can’t cut corners on safety. A vaccine will only end the pandemic if it is safe and effective, and if the American people TRUST that it is safe and effective. I want to end the pandemic as soon as possible. But without the best science, that’s impossible. 2/2

We’ve passed 6 million confirmed COVID-19 cases. We still don’t have a comprehensive national strategy to contain and defeat the disease. It’s not too late- pass the Heroes Act and provide a national testing strategy now!

The USPS is still in jeopardy. The administration must abandon its sabotage efforts immediately and restore service. Our democracy, and the health and wellbeing of the people who rely on deliveries is at stake.

The Heroes Act protects and supports frontline workers. It boosts SNAP and extends UI payments. It provides aid to schools, cities, and states to support essential services. It provides aid to businesses and healthcare providers. 1/2

The GOP will have another chance to completely destroy the Affordable Care Act-- devastating millions, as we continue to battle a pandemic--just days after the election. We need to #DefendOurCare at all costs.

Our communities have made impressive progress in suppressing the latest wave of Covid-19, but we can’t let down our guard. We know what needs to be done. Wear a mask. Avoid gathering indoors. Stay safe, stay distanced. We’re all in this together.

I proudly voted to pass the Heroes Act 100 Days ago. If the Senate had acted, we would have saved the USPS, provided billions to states & localities, and established a national testing strategy. We would have saved lives and could have contained the virus. 1/2
